newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: BES financial margin seen steady in '97.
newsitem.headline: BES financial margin seen steady in '97.

text.p: The financial margin of Portuguese bank Banco Espirito Santo (BES) is expected to be steady or to rise slightly in 1997, the bank's president Ricardo Espirito Santo Salgago said.
"It is possible to predict that margins will not continue to fall, or that they could recover slightly," he told Reuters after the release of the bank's 1996 results.
The bank's financial margin eased to 2.7 percent in 1996 from 2.9 percent in 1995.
BES announced a 21.3 percent increase in net consolidated profit to 23.593 billion escudos.
